models.heroContent: The static text displayed in the hero banner at the top of the page — a headline and subtitle that communicate HookHub's purpose within 5 seconds.
models.hooks: Each hook is an open-source Claude Code hook listed in the directory. Hooks have a display name, description from GitHub, star count, purpose category, lifecycle event, and a link to the source repository.
models.purposeCategories: The eight classifications of what a hook does: Safety, Automation, Notification, Formatting, Testing, Security, Logging, and Custom.
models.lifecycleEvents: The five points in the Claude Code execution lifecycle when a hook can fire: PreToolUse, PostToolUse, UserPromptSubmit, Notification, and Stop.

relationships: Each Hook has exactly one PurposeCategory (what it does)
Each Hook has exactly one LifecycleEvent (when it fires)
PurposeCategory and LifecycleEvent are the two filter dimensions users can combine with AND logic

heroContent.headline: Discover Claude Code Hooks
heroContent.subtitle: A curated directory of open-source hooks for Claude Code — browse, filter, and find the right hook for your workflow.

hooks.name: safe-rm
hooks.description: Prevents accidental deletion of critical system files and project directories by intercepting rm, rmdir, and unlink commands against a configurable blocklist of protected paths.

hooks.name: auto-prettier
hooks.description: Runs Prettier on any file modified by Claude Code, ensuring consistent code formatting without manual intervention. Supports .prettierrc configuration.

hooks.name: slack-notify
hooks.description: Sends a Slack message to a configured channel when Claude Code finishes a task, including a summary of files changed and the final status.

hooks.name: test-on-save
hooks.description: Automatically runs affected test suites after file modifications using jest --findRelatedTests, catching regressions as Claude writes code.

hooks.name: secret-scanner
hooks.description: Scans file contents for hardcoded API keys, tokens, passwords, and other secrets before allowing write operations. Uses pattern matching and entropy detection.

hooks.name: git-auto-stage
hooks.description: Stages modified files in git after successful edits, keeping the working tree clean and ready for commits.

hooks.name: change-ledger
hooks.description: Maintains a structured JSON log of every file change made during a Claude Code session, including timestamps, diffs, and tool invocations.

hooks.name: prompt-guard
hooks.description: Validates user prompts against configurable rules before submission — blocks destructive commands like 'delete everything' or 'drop database' and requests confirmation for high-risk operations.

hooks.name: dep-audit
hooks.description: Runs npm audit or pnpm audit automatically after package.json changes, blocking the session if critical vulnerabilities are introduced.

hooks.name: session-recap
hooks.description: Generates a markdown summary of the entire Claude Code session on completion — files touched, tools used, decisions made — and saves it to .claude/recaps/.
